intro: Psiadia trinervia, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Psiadia trinervia is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, making it a characteristic species of its native environment.
